ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: There's no use in really trying to contribute to society because I probably won't succeed.
When I look ahead to the future, I expect to feel like a burden on the people in my life.
I will always fail the people in my life.
I might as well give up because in the future I will make things worse for others.
There's no use in trying to make people happy because they would be better off if I were gone.
There's no use in really trying to interact with people because I don't feel like I belong.
I will always feel disconnected from other people.
I expect that people will never care about me.
I might as well give up because I will always be an outsider in social gatherings.
My past experiences have made me aware that I will never be able to turn to anyone in times of need.
